title: Software
text:
Software

OTTR
Edit once, publish everywhere!
OTTR (Open-source Tools for Training Resources) is a free suite of tools and templates that streamlines creating educational websites and online courses using GitHub. With no software installations required, OTTR automatically handles content previews, spell-checking, link validation, and multi-platform publishing to sites like Coursera and Leanpub. Educators simply write in R Markdown/Quarto, and OTTR’s automated workflows handle the technical details. OTTR lets you focus on content creation while it manages the infrastructure for scalable, high-quality educational resources.


Metric Miner

title: Data Science Collaborative
text:
partial honey comb

library(ggplot2)
set.seed(222) #123 isn't bad
data <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100, mean = 0, sd = 0.04),  # Tighter cluster around 0
                   y = rnorm(100, mean = 0, sd = 0.04))  # Tighter cluster around 0

# Filter out extreme points
data <- data[data$x > -0.1 & data$x < 0.1 & data$y > -0.1 & data$y < 0.1, ]

# Create plt with  gold yellow hexagons
hc <-ggplot(data, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_hex(aes(fill = ..count..), color = "white", binwidth = c(0.02, 0.02)) + # Specify binwidth for larger hexagons
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "#FFD700", high = "#FFD700") +
  theme_void()+theme(legend.position= "none") + xlim(c(-0.04,max(data$x))) + ylim(c(-.1, 0.1))
hc

Warning: The dot-dot notation (`..count..`) was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `after_stat(count)` instead.


Warning: Removed 16 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range
(`stat_binhex()`).


Warning: Computation failed in `stat_binhex()`.
Caused by error in `compute_group()`:
! The package "hexbin" is required for `stat_bin_hex()`.








ggsave("resources/images/small_hc_solid2.png", hc, width = 5.41, height = 5.41) #save the hex

Warning: Removed 16 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range
(`stat_binhex()`).
Computation failed in `stat_binhex()`.



library(ggplot2)
set.seed(222) #123 isn't bad
data <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100, mean = 0, sd = 0.04),  # Tighter cluster around 0
                   y = rnorm(100, mean = 0, sd = 0.04))  # Tighter cluster around 0

# Filter out extreme points
data <- data[data$x > -0.1 & data$x < 0.1 & data$y > -0.1 & data$y < 0.1, ]

# Create plt with  gold yellow hexagons
hc <-ggplot(data, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_hex(aes(fill = ..count..), color = "white", binwidth = c(0.03, 0.03)) + # Specify binwidth for larger hexagons
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "#FFD700", high = "#FFD700") +
  theme_void()+theme(legend.position= "none") + xlim(c(-0.04,max(data$x))) + ylim(c(-.1, 0.1))
hc

! The package "hexbin" is required for `stat_bin_hex()`.








ggsave("resources/images/small_hc_solid3.png", hc, width = 5.41, height = 5.41) #save the hex

title: Data Science Collaborative
text:
more colors

set.seed(123)
data <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100, mean = 0, sd = 0.05),  # Tighter cluster around 0
                   y = rnorm(100, mean = 0, sd = 0.05))  # Tighter cluster around 0

# Filter out extreme points
data <- data[data$x > -0.1 & data$x < 0.1 & data$y > -0.1 & data$y < 0.1, ]

# Create a ggplot with larger gold yellow hexagons
hc <-ggplot(data, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_hex(aes(fill = ..count..), color = "white", binwidth = c(0.02, 0.02)) + # Specify binwidth for larger hexagons
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "#FFFACD", high = "#FFD700") + # Gold yellow color
  theme_void()+theme(legend.position= "none")
hc

Warning: Computation failed in `stat_binhex()`.
Caused by error in `compute_group()`:
! The package "hexbin" is required for `stat_bin_hex()`.








ggsave("resources/images/small_hc_gradient.png", hc) #save the hex

Saving 7 x 5 in image


Warning: Computation failed in `stat_binhex()`.
Caused by error in `compute_group()`:
! The package "hexbin" is required for `stat_bin_hex()`.

title: Data Science Collaborative
text:
full grid honey comb

set.seed(123)
data <- data.frame(x = runif(10000, min = -0.1, max = 0.1),  # Uniform distribution
                   y = runif(10000, min = -0.1, max = 0.1),  d = runif(10000, min = -0.1, max = 0.1) )  # Uniform distribution

# Create a ggplot with larger gold yellow hexagons
hc <-ggplot(data, aes(x = x, y = y, fill =d)) +
  geom_hex(aes(fill = ..count..), color = "white", binwidth = c(0.02, 0.02)) + # Specify binwidth for hexagons
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "#FFFACD", high = "#FFD700") + # Gold yellow color
  theme_void() + theme(legend.position= "none")

ggsave("resources/images/grid_hc_gradient.png", hc) 

Saving 7 x 5 in image


Warning: Computation failed in `stat_binhex()`.
Caused by error in `compute_group()`:
! The package "hexbin" is required for `stat_bin_hex()`.

title: Contact Us
text:
If you have questions please contact:

Carrie Wright (cwrigh60@jhu.edu)

title: Join us!
text:
Join us!
We actively seek collaborative opportunities with educators, researchers, and institutions who share our vision of transforming how data science is understood and learned. Whether you’re interested in contributing educational content, developing curriculum materials, or exploring new research approaches, we’d love to hear from you! Join us in facilitating ethical data science research and creating educational resources that make data accessible to learners everywhere.
Please contact the lead of the project(s) that most interest you.
